{"step_by_step_thinking": "Craniostenosis, also known as craniosynostosis, is a condition in which one or more of the fibrous sutures in an infant's skull prematurely fuses by turning into bone, changing the growth pattern of the skull. While it can be caused by a variety of factors, genetic mutations have been identified in some cases of craniosynostosis. Therefore, there is a genetic cause in some cases.", "answer_choice": "A"}
